Direct message the job poster from Solaris Paper, Inc
Danny Petre
Award-Winning Global Brand Marketer
ABOUT SOLARIS Solaris Paper is a tissue-converting company with affiliated plants and warehouses across the US. It’s been in business since 2007 and has steadily grown in the away-from-home (AFH), retail private label (PL) and retail branded (FIORA) sales channels.
DEPARTMENTCategory Analytics is a vital department in Retail Sales, reporting directly to the Vice President of Sales and Marketing.
JOB PURPOSE The Director of Category Analytics leads a team of category Analysts who are experts on shelf/assortment management and analytics and in understanding consumer and category trends. This job plays a critical role in Fiora’s broader Sales Team and will proactively influence how Fiora wins at the Shelf. The Director of Category Analytics is grounded in insights and acts in the best interest of the category. This role is part of a dynamic and diverse functional team working to increase the utility of various category management tools through training, establishing processes, and sharing of best practices. Ultimately, this role exists to create short- and long-term value to its assigned retailers and Sales Directors and Fiora brand.
KEY ROLES Ensures strong data-based support to the retail sales team, retail marketing team and Internal stakeholders in Indonesia. KEY RESPONSIBILITIESProactively identify and lead category management initiatives that drive category growth while increasing Fiora sales/share and profits. This should include interpreting shopper and category insights, optimizing product assortment, evaluating product placement, and proposing solutions to improve overall category performance.Category Management expert and advisor to leadership. Influence decision-makers by reviewing and analyzing shelf space opportunities, as well as current business trends and category performance within the market and industry.Responsible for leading and delivering space management projects for all assigned customers.Proactively communicating and working with Sales Directors and Broker Partners on assortment opportunities, including void closures, at-risk items, innovation, and core assortmentBuild and maintain long-term relationships with assigned retailers. Leverage insights and recommend action plans for assigned retailers by developing persuasive, fact-based sales presentations that leverage customer, industry, market, and competitive informationMaintain frequent and fluid communication with internal and external stakeholders, including Indonesia, regarding projects, insights, and/or opportunities for self and for the team.Build and maintain reporting, as well as communicate findings gleaned from them.Other duties as assigned KEY WORKING RELATIONSHIPS Internal:CEO and Vice President of SalesRetail Sales DirectorsRetail Sales Marketing TeamIndonesia HQ External:Key data resources, including NielsenKey RetailersBroker Partners KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES (JOB SPECS) Education & Knowledge Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience10+ years of data analysis/category management experience, including Nielsen and IRICPG experience Skills & AbilitiesStrong analytical skills, proven ability to use data and analytics to develop insightsStrong presentation skillsProven knowledge of category management processes and applications, understanding the impact on the businessStrong computer skills – excel at an advanced level, PowerPoint, data mining/access softwareFamiliar with retail scan data, metrics, consumer panel data, and shopper data (i.e., Nielsen, Homescan, Spectra, Retailer Loyalty Card data)Understands chain sales, retail and distributor operationsWorks well within a cross-functional support environment
WORK ENVIRONMENT
Reviews with Sales Directors and Indonesialeadership callsposition may be required on occasion to travel by car and airline to offices across the US.LA-based but would consider West Coast Geography.
